description: The Church was built in 1874 by R.J Withers. The adjoining building was remodeled by Goodhart Rendell in the 1920s Arts and Crafts style. The Pineapple Project for community use, by Matthew Lloyd Architects, was completed this year.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: St Mary's was a Victorian mission church (1874) to a poor part of Pimlico. It was extensively redecorated and refurbished between the wars by the architects  Goodhart Rendell and Martin Travers in an opulent Anglo Catholic style. The adjacent arts and crafts building by Goodhart Rendell is being remodelled this year as part of the Pineapple Project to provide significant new community spaces.

location.address: The Church of St Mary's Bourne Street, Westminster, SW1W 8JJ
travel_info: Additional travel info: Five minutes from Sloane Square

name: The Church of St Mary's and new community centre
